original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); During the past few months, an increased trend in the number of dengue cases have been reported in Sri Lanka.
An increased number of cases have been reported from Colombo and Gampaha Districts.
A total of 80,222 dengue patients have been reported so far in 2023, said the National Dengue Control Unit, adding that 16,948 of these cases were reported from the Colombo District.
In addition, a total of 15,419 dengue cases were reported in the Gampaha District.
The National Dengue Control Unit said that 61 Dengue High Risk Zones have been identified across the country.
Moreover, 47 people succumbed to dengue this year, it added.
The National Dengue Control Unit is urging the public to ensure that their surroundings are clean, and mosquito breeding grounds are destroyed without delay.
The State and Public service trade unions collective plans to go on sick leave tomorrow.
A person who illegally imported a consignment of foreign cigarettes into the island arrested at BIA.
A fire has broken out at the Methsiri Sewana building in the Anuradhapura Teaching Hospital
State Minister of Defence says security at the Mihintale sacred site was not removed
